questions.question: Which job roles are part of a development team? (Select TWO.)

explanation.summary: Systems administrators manage IT infrastructure and servers, not the software development process itself. They focus on keeping servers running, managing networks, configuring operating systems, and maintaining hardware.
explanation.why: While they may collaborate with developers, sysadmins are part of IT operations, not the development team.

explanation.summary: Technical support engineers work at the intersection of users and developers. They are the first line of defense when users report bugs or issues in the software. These reports go directly back into the development cycle, making technical support engineers crucial team members who provide valuable feedback for continuous improvement.
keyPoints: Document and reproduce bugs reported by customers
Work closely with developers to verify fixes and test solutions
Provide critical user feedback that drives product improvements
Help prioritize issues based on user impact and frequency
examples: When a user reports that an application crashes when uploading large files, the technical support engineer reproduces the issue, gathers system logs, identifies the conditions that cause the crash, and submits a detailed bug report to the development team. They then verify the fix in the next release.

explanation.summary: Project managers coordinate and manage the development process but don't typically write code or perform development work themselves.
explanation.why: They focus on planning, scheduling, resource allocation, and ensuring the project stays on track—management activities rather than development activities.

learnMore.title: Aalpha - Role of Software Project Manager

explanation.summary: Product marketing managers focus on marketing strategy, positioning, messaging, and promoting the product to potential customers. They don't write code or test software.
explanation.why: Their expertise is in understanding market needs, competitive analysis, and creating go-to-market strategies.

explanation.summary: Software developers are the core members of any development team. They write, test, and maintain the code that makes software applications work. Developers transform requirements and designs into functional software by writing clean, efficient code in programming languages like Python, Java, JavaScript, C++, and others.
keyPoints: Translate user requirements into technical specifications
Write clean and maintainable code
Perform initial testing (unit tests, smoke tests) before sending code to QA
Use version control systems like Git to manage code
Conduct code reviews to ensure quality
Document code and technical decisions
examples: A developer receives a requirement to add a 'forgot password' feature. They design the database schema for password reset tokens, write the backend API endpoints, create the frontend form and email template, write unit tests to verify functionality, and submit the code for peer review before it moves to QA testing.

learnMore.title: UpGrad - Roles and Responsibilities of Software Developer

questions.question: Which job role writes code and runs initial tests to confirm that the product works?

explanation.summary: Database administrators manage database systems, not application code. They focus on database design, performance optimization, security, backups, and access control.
explanation.why: While DBAs write SQL queries and scripts, they don't write the application logic or perform application testing.

explanation.summary: QA engineers test software after developers have written and initially tested it. They perform comprehensive testing including functional testing, regression testing, user acceptance testing, and exploratory testing. QA tests the product from an end-user perspective to find bugs that developers might have missed.
explanation.why: The testing workflow: Developer writes code → Developer runs initial tests → Code passes to QA → QA performs comprehensive testing → QA finds bugs → Developer fixes bugs → QA verifies fixes.

learnMore.title: Indeed India - What Is a QA Engineer?

explanation.summary: Software developers are responsible for both writing the application code and performing initial testing to ensure it works correctly before passing it to the QA team. These initial tests include unit tests (testing individual components), smoke tests (basic functionality checks), and integration tests (verifying components work together).
keyPoints: Unit tests verify individual functions work correctly
Smoke tests are quick checks to verify the build works and major features function
Integration tests verify how different parts of the code work together
Modern software development follows Test-Driven Development (TDD) where developers write tests before or alongside the code
examples: A developer implements a new user registration feature. They write the code for the registration form, database integration, and email verification. Before submitting for code review, they write unit tests for password validation, email format checking, and database operations. They run these tests locally, manually test the registration flow in the application, and verify the confirmation email sends correctly. Only after all these initial tests pass do they submit the code to the QA team.

learnMore.title: GeeksforGeeks - What Does a Software Developer Do?

explanation.summary: Analysts (business analysts, data analysts, or systems analysts) focus on understanding requirements, analyzing data, and bridging the gap between business needs and technical solutions.
explanation.why: They don't write production code or perform software testing.

questions.question: Which job role maintains a list of different types of tests and runs all tests to verify that each product release works?

explanation.summary: Software developers perform initial, focused testing on the code they write (unit tests, smoke tests), but they don't maintain comprehensive test suites or run all tests across the entire application.
explanation.why: Their testing is limited to verifying their own code works before passing it to QA. Developers test what they build, but they don't have the objectivity or comprehensive view needed to test the entire system.

explanation.summary: Database administrators manage database systems and their performance, security, and reliability. They don't test application functionality or maintain application test suites.
explanation.why: DBAs test database performance, query optimization, backup and recovery procedures, and database security—but not application features or user workflows.

learnMore.title: Bureau of Labor Statistics - Database Administrators
CompTIA - What Does a DBA Do?

explanation.summary: Analysts focus on requirements gathering, business process analysis, and data analysis. They help define what should be tested by documenting requirements and acceptance criteria, but they don't execute testing or maintain test suites.
explanation.why: Analysts work at the requirements and specification level, not the testing execution level.

explanation.summary: Quality assurance engineers are responsible for comprehensive testing of software products. They maintain test suites, create and execute test plans, manage regression testing, and verify that every release meets quality standards before it reaches end users. QA owns the end-to-end testing process and acts as the final gatekeeper for software quality.
keyPoints: Create and maintain comprehensive test plans and test cases
Manage regression test suites that run before each release
Perform multiple types of testing (functional, integration, system, acceptance)
Document test results and track defects
Verify bug fixes and ensure no new issues are introduced
Coordinate testing activities across development cycles
testTypes: Functional testing verifies that each feature works according to specifications
Regression testing re-runs existing tests to ensure new code changes haven't broken previously working functionality
Integration testing verifies how different system components work together
User acceptance testing checks from an end-user perspective
Performance testing checks how the system performs under load
examples: Before releasing version 2.0 of an e-commerce application, the QA engineer executes the complete test plan which includes 150 functional test cases covering all features, 300 regression tests to verify nothing broke, 50 integration tests for payment processing and shipping APIs, 25 performance tests for page load times, and 40 security tests for user authentication. They document every test result, report 15 bugs to the development team, verify all fixes, and sign off on the release when all tests pass.

questions.question: What are the responsibilities of the database administrator? (Select TWO.)

options.text: Write acceptance criteria for the program

explanation.summary: Writing acceptance criteria is the responsibility of business analysts, product owners, or product managers—not database administrators.
explanation.why: Acceptance criteria define what conditions must be met for a feature to be considered complete and acceptable to stakeholders. DBAs focus on technical database management, not business requirements or feature specifications.

explanation.summary: Database security is a primary responsibility of DBAs. They implement comprehensive security measures to protect sensitive data from unauthorized access, breaches, corruption, and loss. This includes encryption, authentication, security patches, audit trails, and compliance with regulations like GDPR, HIPAA, or SOC 2.
keyPoints: Implement database encryption for data at rest and in transit
Apply security patches and updates to database software
Configure firewalls and network security for database servers
Create and monitor audit trails to track data access
Ensure compliance with data protection regulations
Protect against SQL injection and other security threats
examples: A healthcare organization's DBA implements HIPAA-compliant security measures: encrypts all patient data at rest using AES-256 encryption, enables TLS encryption for all database connections, implements role-based access control so only authorized medical staff can access patient records, configures audit logging to track every access to patient data, applies monthly security patches to the database server, and ensures backup tapes are encrypted and stored securely.

learnMore.title: Baker College - Role of Database Administrator
Potomac - What Does a DBA Do?

explanation.summary: Creating project plans is the responsibility of project managers, not database administrators.
explanation.why: Project plans include timelines, milestones, resource allocation, budgets, and schedules—all project management activities. DBAs are technical specialists who manage databases, not project coordination.

explanation.summary: DBAs control who can access the database and what they can do with the data. They create user accounts, assign permissions, implement role-based access control, and ensure users have appropriate access levels based on their job functions—no more, no less (principle of least privilege).
keyPoints: Create and manage database user accounts
Implement role-based access control
Assign granular permissions (read, write, delete, execute)
Ensure principle of least privilege
Manage access for applications and services
Regularly review and update access permissions
examples: A company's DBA configures access for a new e-commerce application: creates a service account for the application, grants it SELECT permission on the products and inventory tables, grants INSERT and UPDATE permissions on the orders and customers tables, denies access to employee salary data, creates a read-only analytics role for the marketing team to query sales data, and sets up an admin role with full permissions for the development team. When a developer leaves the company, the DBA immediately revokes their database access.

learnMore.title: DSP - Key Responsibilities of a DBA

explanation.summary: Product testing is performed by QA engineers and software developers, not database administrators.
explanation.why: While DBAs might test database performance, queries, and backup procedures, they don't test the application or product functionality. DBAs test database-specific functionality, not user-facing features or application workflows.

questions.question: What are the responsibilities of the project manager? (Select TWO.)

explanation.summary: While project managers are involved in planning, the actual conversion of requirements into specific technical tasks is typically done by development team leads, senior developers, or the development team collaboratively during sprint planning.
explanation.why: Converting requirements into tasks requires deep technical knowledge of the codebase, architecture, and implementation details.

explanation.summary: Creating comprehensive project plans is a core responsibility of project managers. The project plan is the roadmap for the entire project, defining scope, timeline, resources, milestones, deliverables, and how success will be measured. It serves as the central reference document that keeps everyone aligned throughout the project.
keyPoints: Define project scope, objectives, and deliverables
Create detailed timelines with milestones and deadlines
Identify required resources (people, tools, budget)
Establish communication plans and reporting structure
Define risks and mitigation strategies
Set quality standards and success criteria
examples: A project manager creates a plan for a mobile app development project: defines scope (iOS and Android apps with user authentication, product catalog, shopping cart, payment integration), creates an 8-month timeline with milestones (design completion month 2, backend API month 4, iOS app month 6, Android app month 7, testing and launch month 8), allocates resources (2 backend developers, 2 mobile developers, 1 designer, 1 QA engineer), budgets $300,000, identifies risks (third-party payment API integration might be complex), and establishes weekly status meetings with monthly stakeholder presentations.

learnMore.title: TatvaSoft - Role of Software Project Manager

explanation.summary: Project managers distribute work among team members by assigning specific tasks based on skills, availability, and workload. They ensure everyone knows what they're responsible for, when it's due, and how it fits into the larger project. Effective task assignment balances workload, leverages individual strengths, and keeps the project moving forward.
keyPoints: Assign tasks based on team members' skills and expertise
Balance workload to prevent burnout or idle time
Consider task dependencies and sequencing
Track who is working on what
Adjust assignments when priorities change
Ensure clear ownership and accountability
examples: During sprint planning, the project manager assigns tasks from the backlog: assigns the 'user authentication' feature to Sarah (senior backend developer with security expertise), assigns the 'product filter UI' to Mike (frontend developer), assigns 'payment gateway integration' to David (developer experienced with payment APIs), and assigns 'test automation suite' to Lisa (QA engineer). The PM ensures no one has more than 40 hours of work assigned for the two-week sprint.

options.text: Write acceptance criteria to measure the successful completion of the application

explanation.summary: Writing acceptance criteria is the responsibility of product owners, business analysts, or product managers—not project managers.
explanation.why: Acceptance criteria define what conditions must be met for a feature to be considered complete and are written from a business/user perspective. Project managers focus on managing the execution, not defining what makes features acceptable from a business standpoint.

explanation.summary: Requirements gathering is primarily the responsibility of business analysts, product owners, or product managers—not project managers.
explanation.why: These roles specialize in understanding stakeholder needs, documenting requirements, and translating business needs into functional specifications. While project managers participate in requirements discussions, they don't lead the requirements gathering process.
